page.title: 11THE VILLAGE OF PICA
page.content: Mr&Mrs Blenkingsop were born in Pica,a small community of 90 houses.Mrs Blenkingsops sister still lives there. Pica was built for the coal mine called Oaklands Colliery which belonged to the Lowther Estate.The stone for the houses was quarried next to the village the quarry is now a playground.Pica is another name for a magpie and its thought that this is where the village got its name.The Blenkingsops went to Dyon Council school.The school is still there but it is split up into two houses.There was a cooperative shop and three sweet shops.There was a playing field next to the school but there is a bungalow built on it now.There were 5 teachers at the school and 120 children.The mine closed in 1933.
